Posts.Content: On Aug 04, 2015 1:05 PM cedge wrote: I had early stage breast cancer last year and mastectomy and was put onto anastrazole.  No node involvement and so no chemo etc  Side effects not too bad but my consultant decided I could try giving it up for a while to see if fatigue and general feeling of flu disappeared.  But after 2 weeks off the pill I feel even worse which is most worrying.  Lots of aches - though not really pain.  Anyone else come off this med and had a bad time?? My question to you is your cancer metastatic?  It's hard to tell by your statement.  If it's not metastatic you really need to consult another oncologist.  In treatment of cancer Always seek out more than one opinion.  As for AI Anastrozole the shelf life in your body on an active pill differs from the effects.  If you are not experiencing the symptoms and have developed new ones, You need to consult your DR.  However, damage caused by this drug with some of the effects are relieved in weeks or months.  However, bone and other issues can be a lifetime.  Some people come to a full peak of withdrawal which is the toughest in the first month.    Again see a Dr as cancer is not a sniffle or a common cold.
